opener.fw: Mr. John G. Neihardt Columbia, Missouri

div1.p: I remember with a great deal of pleasure the time you came to our college for a writer's workshop.

I do not know whether you are aware that Missouri Association of Teachers of English is working on a Literary Landmarks Project. We are trying to gain recognition for Missouri writers--those who were born here and those who are associated with the state by their residence of writings. Since Missouri Writers' Day is in October, we plan to publish a special edition of the MATE Bulletin which will include about fifty biographies. Of course your biography will be included. These will have to be brief--possibly 340 or 350 words. The data will include the writer's association with Missouri and his principal works. I'll included a mimeographed sheet which will give you an idea.
Will you send me what information you would like to have in your biography for this Bulletin?
I also think it would be very special if you would consent to write a short foreword or kind of salute to Missouri Writers for my introductory page.
We desire to place a bronze marker on houses where writers have lived. You former home at Branson will be included if we can obtain money for this phase of our project.
I realize we have a tremendous undertaking before us, but I am happy to have some very competent and enthusiastic people on my committee.
May I hear from you at your earliest convenience?

closer.note: Mareta Beatrice Williams Chairman, Literary Landmarks Committee of Missouri
